00017 /*
00018  * There are many tolerances involved in an Lstar calculation.  Here we try and
00019  * set them qualitatively given a single "quality" value.
00020  */
00021 void SetLstarTolerances( int Quality, Lgm_LstarInfo *s ) {
00022     
00023     if ( ( Quality < 0 ) || ( Quality > 8 ) ) {
00024         printf("%sSetLstarTolerances: Quality value (of %d) not in range [0, 8]. Setting to 5.%s\n", s->PreStr, Quality, s->PostStr );
00025         Quality = 5;
00026     }
00027 
00028     // These tend to be critical to keep things working smoothly.
00029     s->mInfo->Lgm_FindBmRadius_Tol       = 1e-10;
00030     s->mInfo->Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint_Tol = 1e-10;
00031 
00032 
00033     switch ( Quality ) {
00034 
00035         case 8: // Highest Quality -- (although 7 may be better?)
00036 
00037             s->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00038             s->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-6;
00039 
00040             s->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00041             s->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-6;
00042 
00043             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator        = DQAGS;
00044             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsrel = 0.0;
00045             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsabs = 1e-8;
00046 
00047             s->mInfo->Lgm_FindShellLine_I_Tol = 1e-8;
00048 
00049             break;
00050 
00051         case 7:
00052 
00053             s->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00054             s->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-6;
00055 
00056             s->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00057             s->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-6;
00058 
00059             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator        = DQAGS;
00060             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsrel = 0.0;
00061             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsabs = 1e-7;
00062 
00063             s->mInfo->Lgm_FindShellLine_I_Tol = 1e-7;
00064 
00065             break;
00066 
00067         case 6:
00068 
00069             s->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00070             s->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-5;
00071 
00072             s->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00073             s->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-5;
00074 
00075             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator        = DQAGS;
00076             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsrel = 0.0;
00077             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsabs = 1e-6;
00078 
00079             s->mInfo->Lgm_FindShellLine_I_Tol = 1e-6;
00080 
00081             break;
00082 
00083         case 5:
00084 
00085             s->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00086             s->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-4;
00087 
00088             s->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00089             s->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-4;
00090 
00091             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator        = DQAGS;
00092             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsrel = 0.0;
00093             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsabs = 1e-5;
00094 
00095             s->mInfo->Lgm_FindShellLine_I_Tol = 1e-5;
00096 
00097             break;
00098 
00099         case 4:
00100 
00101             s->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00102             s->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-3;
00103 
00104             s->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00105             s->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-3;
00106 
00107             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator        = DQAGS;
00108             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsrel = 0.0;
00109             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsabs = 1e-4;
00110 
00111             s->mInfo->Lgm_FindShellLine_I_Tol = 1e-4;
00112 
00113             break;
00114 
00115         case 3:
00116 
00117             s->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00118             s->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-3;
00119 
00120             s->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00121             s->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-3;
00122 
00123             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator        = DQAGS;
00124             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsrel = 0.0;
00125             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsabs = 1e-3;
00126 
00127             s->mInfo->Lgm_FindShellLine_I_Tol = 1e-3;
00128 
00129             break;
00130 
00131         case 2:
00132 
00133             s->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00134             s->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-3;
00135 
00136             s->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00137             s->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-3;
00138 
00139             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator        = DQAGS;
00140             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsrel = 0.0;
00141             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsabs = 1e-2;
00142 
00143             s->mInfo->Lgm_FindShellLine_I_Tol = 1e-2;
00144 
00145             break;
00146 
00147         case 1:
00148 
00149             s->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00150             s->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-3;
00151 
00152             s->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00153             s->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-3;
00154 
00155             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator        = DQAGS;
00156             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsrel = 0.0;
00157             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsabs = 1e-1;
00158 
00159             s->mInfo->Lgm_FindShellLine_I_Tol = 1e-1;
00160 
00161             break;
00162 
00163         case 0:
00164 
00165             s->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00166             s->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-3;
00167 
00168             s->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00169             s->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-3;
00170 
00171             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator        = DQK21; // Note - changed to simpler integrator.
00172             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsrel = 0.0;
00173             s->mInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsabs = 1e-1;
00174 
00175             s->mInfo->Lgm_FindShellLine_I_Tol = 1e-1;
00176 
00177             break;
00178 
00179     }
00180 
00181     
00182     return;
00183 
00184 
00185 }

00188 
00189 Lgm_LstarInfo *InitLstarInfo( int VerbosityLevel ) {
00190 
00191     Lgm_LstarInfo   *LstarInfo;
00192 
00193 
00194     /*
00195      *  Allocate memory for LstarInfo structure
00196      */
00197     LstarInfo = (Lgm_LstarInfo *) calloc( 1, sizeof( *LstarInfo));
00198 
00199 
00200     /*
00201      *  Allocate memory for mInfo structure inside the LstarInfo structure.
00202      */
00203     LstarInfo->mInfo = Lgm_InitMagInfo( );
00204 
00205 
00206 
00207     /*
00208      *  Default Settings
00209      */
00210     LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel = 2;
00211     LstarInfo->LSimpleMax     = 10.0;
00212 
00213     LstarInfo->PreStr[0]  = '\0';
00214     LstarInfo->PostStr[0] = '\0';
00215 
00216     return LstarInfo;
00217 
00218 }

00220 
00221 void FreeLstarInfo( Lgm_LstarInfo *s ) {
00222 
00223     Lgm_FreeMagInfo( s->mInfo );
00224     free( s );
00225 
00226 }

00229 
00230 /*
00231  *  The Lgm_LstarInfo structure has pointers in it, so simple
00232  *  asignments (e.g. *t = *s) are dangerous. Here we make sure that
00233  *  the target gets an independent copy of the structure.
00234  */
00235 Lgm_LstarInfo *Lgm_CopyLstarInfo( Lgm_LstarInfo *s ) {
00236 
00237     Lgm_LstarInfo       *t;
00238     Lgm_MagModelInfo *m;
00239     Lgm_CTrans       *c;
00240 
00241     if ( s == NULL) {
00242         printf("%sLgm_CopyLstarInfo: Error, source structure is NULL%s\n", s->PreStr, s->PostStr);
00243         return( NULL );
00244     }
00245 
00246 
00247     /*
00248      *  Allocate memory for target Lgm_LstarInfo struct
00249      */
00250     t = (Lgm_LstarInfo *)calloc(1, sizeof(Lgm_LstarInfo));
00251 
00252     /*
00253      *  Copy memory
00254      */
00255     memcpy( t, s, sizeof(*s) );
00256 
00257 
00258     /*
00259      *  Copy MagInfo struct
00260      */
00261     t->mInfo = Lgm_CopyMagInfo( s->mInfo );
00262 
00263 
00264     t->mInfo->Lgm_MagStep_FirstTimeThrough = TRUE;
00265     t->mInfo->Lgm_MagStep_eps_old = -1.0;
00266 
00267 
00268     return( t );
00269 
00270 
00271 
00272 }

00281 void NewTimeLstarInfo( long int Date, double UT, double PitchAngle, int (*Mag)(Lgm_Vector *, Lgm_Vector *, Lgm_MagModelInfo *), Lgm_LstarInfo *LstarInfo ){

00288 
00289 
00290     /*
00291      *  Set mag field model
00292      */
00293     LstarInfo->mInfo->Bfield = Mag;
00294 
00295 
00296     /*
00297      *  Set Pitch Angle
00298      */
00299     LstarInfo->PitchAngle = PitchAngle;
00300 
00301 
00302 }

00306 
00307 int Lstar( Lgm_Vector *vin, Lgm_LstarInfo *LstarInfo ){
00308 
00309 
00310     Lgm_Vector  u, v, w, v1, v2, v3, Bvec;
00311     int     i, j, k, nk, nLines, koffset, tkk, nfp, nnn;
00312     int     done2, Count, FoundShellLine;
00313     double  B, dSa, dSb, smax, SS, L;
00314     double  I=-999.9, Ifound, M, MLT0, MLT, mlat, r;
00315     double  Phi, Phi1, Phi2, sl, cl, MirrorMLT[500], MirrorMlat[500], pred_mlat, pred_delta_mlat=0.0, mlat0, mlat1, delta;
00316     double  MirrorMLT_Old[500], MirrorMlat_Old[500];
00317     char    *PreStr, *PostStr;
00318 //    FILE  *fp;
00319 
00320     PreStr = LstarInfo->PreStr;
00321     PostStr = LstarInfo->PostStr;
00322     
00323 
00324 
00325     if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 0) {
00326         printf("\n\n\t\t%s        Computing L* for, Date: %ld, UT: %g%s\n", PreStr, LstarInfo->mInfo->c->UTC.Date, LstarInfo->mInfo->c->UTC.Time, PostStr );
00327         printf(    "\t\t%s=========================================================================%s\n", PreStr, PostStr );
00328         printf(    "\t\t%sDate (yyyymmdd):                         %ld%s\n", PreStr, LstarInfo->mInfo->c->UTC.Date, PostStr );
00329         printf(    "\t\t%sUTC (hours):                             %g%s\n", PreStr, LstarInfo->mInfo->c->UTC.Time, PostStr );
00330         printf(    "\t\t%sPitch Angle (deg.):                      %g%s\n", PreStr, LstarInfo->PitchAngle, PostStr );
00331         printf(    "\t\t%sMirror Mag. Field Strength, Bm (nT):     %g%s\n", PreStr, LstarInfo->mInfo->Bm, PostStr );
00332     }
00333     LstarInfo->nPnts = 0;
00334 
00335 
00336     if ((LstarInfo->PitchAngle < 0.0)||(LstarInfo->PitchAngle>90.0)) return(-1);
00337 
00338 
00339 
00340     /*
00341      *  Do Initial field Line to get Bm and I
00342      */
00343     u = *vin;
00344     if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 0) {
00345         printf("\n\t\t%sInitial Position, U_gsm (Re):            < %g, %g, %g >%s\n", PreStr, u.x, u.y, u.z, PostStr);
00346         LstarInfo->mInfo->Bfield( &u, &Bvec, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00347         B = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec );
00348         printf("\t\t%sMag. Field Strength, B at U_gsm (nT):    %g%s\n", PreStr, B, PostStr);
00349     }
00350 
00351 
00352 
00353 
00354     if ( Lgm_Trace( &u, &v1, &v2, &v3, 120.0, 1e-7, 1e-7, LstarInfo->mInfo ) == 1 ) {
00355 
00356 
00357         /*
00358          * Trace out FL from southern footprint to northern footprint. This
00359          * call saves the FL points in a form that can be interpolated.
00360          */
00361 //THIS SECTION IS REALLY ONLY HERE TO 1) GET THE FOOTPOINTS and 2) SAVE THE INITIAL FL
00362 // WE PROBABLY NEED TO CHANGE THIS TO BE MORE CONSIST WITH WHAT IS GOING ON IN DRIFTSHELL.c
00363 if (0==1){
00364         LstarInfo->mInfo->Hmax = 0.1;
00365         Lgm_TraceLine2( &v1, &v, 0.0, .01, 1.0, 1e-7, FALSE, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00366 
00367         InitSpline( LstarInfo->mInfo );
00368         LstarInfo->Footprint_Ps[0] = v1;
00369         LstarInfo->Footprint_Pn[0] = v;
00370 
00371         /*
00372          * If SaveShellLines is set true, then save the points
00373          * Note that since we appear to only have the north footpoint. We start there and trace
00374          * to south. So lets pack them in the the saved arrays backwards so that they go from south
00375          * to north.
00376          */
00377         if ( LstarInfo->SaveShellLines ) {
00378 
00379             nnn = LstarInfo->mInfo->nPnts; smax = LstarInfo->mInfo->s[nnn-1];
00380             for (tkk=0, nfp=0; nfp<nnn; nfp++){
00381                 if ( LstarInfo->mInfo->Bmag[nfp] > 0.0 ) {
00382                     LstarInfo->s_gsm[0][tkk] = LstarInfo->mInfo->s[nfp];
00383                     LstarInfo->Bmag[0][tkk]  = LstarInfo->mInfo->Bmag[nfp];
00384                     LstarInfo->x_gsm[0][tkk] = LstarInfo->mInfo->Px[nfp];
00385                     LstarInfo->y_gsm[0][tkk] = LstarInfo->mInfo->Py[nfp];
00386                     LstarInfo->z_gsm[0][tkk] = LstarInfo->mInfo->Pz[nfp];
00387                     ++tkk;
00388                 }
00389             }
00390             LstarInfo->nFieldPnts[0] = tkk;
00391 
00392         }
00393         FreeSpline( LstarInfo->mInfo );
00394         
00395 }
00396 
00397 
00398 
00399 
00400 
00401 
00402 
00403         /*
00404          * Trace from Bmin point up to northern mirror point and down to
00405          * southern mirror point. dSa and dSb are the distances along the
00406          * FL from the starting points point. So dSa is from the Bmin value.
00407          * And dSb is from the Psouth value.
00408          */
00409         if ( Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint( &(LstarInfo->mInfo->Pmin), &(LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South), &dSa, 120.0, LstarInfo->mInfo->Bm, -1.0, LstarInfo->mInfo->Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint_Tol, LstarInfo->mInfo ) >= 0 ) {
00410 
00411             if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 0) {
00412                 printf("\n\t\t%sMirror Point Location, Pm_South (Re):      < %g, %g, %g >%s\n", PreStr, LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South.x, LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South.y, LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South.z, PostStr);
00413                 LstarInfo->mInfo->Bfield( &LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South, &Bvec, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00414                 B = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec );
00415                 printf("\t\t%sMag. Field Strength, Bm at Pm_South (nT):  %g     (LstarInfo->mInfo->Bm = %g)%s\n", PreStr, B, LstarInfo->mInfo->Bm, PostStr);
00416             }
00417 
00418             if ( Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint( &(LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South), &(LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_North), &dSb, 120.0, LstarInfo->mInfo->Bm,  1.0, LstarInfo->mInfo->Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint_Tol, LstarInfo->mInfo ) >= 0 ) {
00419 
00420                 if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 0) {
00421                     printf("\n\t\t%sMirror Point Location, Pm_North (Re):      < %g, %g, %g >%s\n", PreStr, LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_North.x, LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_North.y, LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_North.z, PostStr);
00422                     LstarInfo->mInfo->Bfield( &LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_North, &Bvec, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00423                     B = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec );
00424                     printf("\t\t%sMag. Field Strength, Bm at Pm_North (nT):  %g%s\n", PreStr, B, PostStr);
00425                 }
00426 
00427 
00428                 /*
00429                  *  Set the limits of integration. Define s=0 at the sourthern mirror point. Then, sm_North will just be dSb
00430                  */
00431                 //LstarInfo->mInfo->Sm_South = LstarInfo->mInfo->smin - dSa;
00432                 //LstarInfo->mInfo->Sm_North = LstarInfo->mInfo->Sm_South + dSb;
00433                 SS = dSb;
00434                 LstarInfo->mInfo->Hmax = SS/200.0;
00435                 r  = Lgm_Magnitude( &LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_North );
00436                 LstarInfo->mInfo->Sm_South = 0.0;
00437                 LstarInfo->mInfo->Sm_North = SS;
00438 
00439                 if ( LstarInfo->mInfo->UseInterpRoutines ) {
00440 
00441                     Lgm_TraceLine2( &(LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South), &LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_North, (r-1.0)*Re, 0.5*SS-LstarInfo->mInfo->Hmax, 1.0, 1e-7, FALSE, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00442                     ReplaceFirstPoint( 0.0, LstarInfo->mInfo->Bm, &LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00443                     AddNewPoint( SS,  LstarInfo->mInfo->Bm, &LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_North, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00444                     InitSpline( LstarInfo->mInfo );
00445 
00446                     /*
00447                      *  Do interped I integral.
00448                      */
00449                     I = Iinv_interped( LstarInfo->mInfo  );
00450                     if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 0) printf("\t\t  %sIntegral Invariant, I (interped):      %g%s\n",  PreStr, I, PostStr );
00451 
00452                     FreeSpline( LstarInfo->mInfo );
00453 
00454 
00455                 } else {
00456 
00457                     /*
00458                      *  Do full blown I integral. (Integrand is evaluated by tracing to required s-values.)
00459                      */
00460                     I = Iinv( LstarInfo->mInfo  );
00461                     if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 0) printf("\t\t  %sIntegral Invariant, I (full integral): %g%s\n",  PreStr, I, PostStr );
00462 
00463                 }
00464 
00465 
00466 
00467                 if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 0) {
00468                     // sort this out. FIX User should decide what M they want to use.
00469                     M = LstarInfo->mInfo->c->M_cd_McIllwain;
00470                     M = LstarInfo->mInfo->c->M_cd;
00471                     printf("\t\t  %sLgm_n_I_integrand_Calls:               %d%s\n\n", PreStr, LstarInfo->mInfo->Lgm_n_I_integrand_Calls, PostStr );
00472                     printf("\t\t%sCurrent Dipole Moment, M_cd:             %g%s\n", PreStr, LstarInfo->mInfo->c->M_cd, PostStr);
00473                     printf("\t\t%sReference Dipole Moment, M_cd_McIllwain: %g%s\n", PreStr, LstarInfo->mInfo->c->M_cd_McIllwain, PostStr);
00474                     printf("\t\t%sDipole Moment Used, Mused:               %g%s\n", PreStr, M, PostStr);
00475                     printf("\t\t%sMcIlwain L (Hilton):                     %g%s\n", PreStr, L = LFromIBmM_Hilton( I, LstarInfo->mInfo->Bm, M ), PostStr );
00476                     printf("\t\t%sMcIlwain L (McIlwain):                   %g%s\n", PreStr, L = LFromIBmM_McIlwain( I, LstarInfo->mInfo->Bm, M ), PostStr );
00477                 }
00478 
00479             } else {
00480 
00481                 printf("\t\t%sMirror point below 120km in Northern Hemisphere%s\n", PreStr, PostStr );
00482                 return(-1);
00483 
00484             }
00485 
00486         } else {
00487 
00488             printf("\t\t%sMirror point below 120km in Southern Hemisphere%s\n", PreStr, PostStr );
00489             return(-2);
00490 
00491         }
00492 
00493     }
00494 
00495 
00496 
00497 
00498 
00499 
00500     /*
00501      *  Construct drift shell. Get a good initial estimate for mlat
00502      */
00503     Lgm_Convert_Coords( &LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_North, &u, GSM_TO_SM, LstarInfo->mInfo->c );
00504     mlat = DegPerRad*asin(u.z/Lgm_Magnitude( &u ));
00505     MLT0 = atan2( u.y, u.x )*DegPerRad/15.0 + 12.0;
00506     if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 2) printf("\t\t%smlat = %g%s\n", PreStr, mlat, PostStr );
00507     LstarInfo->nPnts = 0;
00508     pred_delta_mlat  = 0.0;
00509     for (k=0; k<200; ++k){
00510         MirrorMLT[k]  = 0.0;
00511         MirrorMlat[k] = 0.0;
00512     }
00513 
00514 
00515 
00516     nLines = (int)(24.0/DeltaMLT + 0.5);
00517     for ( koffset=nk=k=0, MLT=MLT0; MLT<(MLT0+24.0-1e-10); MLT += DeltaMLT){
00518 
00519     
00520         /*
00521          *  Try to predict what the next mlat should be so we can really
00522          *  narrow down the bracket.
00523          */
00524         if (k == 0 ){
00525 
00526             pred_mlat       = mlat;
00527             pred_delta_mlat = 0.001;
00528             delta           = 0.001;
00529             if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 2) printf("\t\t%sPredicted mlat1 = %g ( %g : %g )%s ", PreStr, pred_mlat, pred_delta_mlat, delta, PostStr ); fflush(stdout);
00530 
00531         } else if ( k > 0 ) {
00532 
00533             PredictMlat2( MirrorMLT, MirrorMlat, k, MLT, &pred_mlat, &pred_delta_mlat, &delta, LstarInfo );
00534             if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 2) printf("\t\t%sPredicted mlat2 = %g ( %g : %g )%s ", PreStr, pred_mlat, pred_delta_mlat, delta, PostStr ); fflush(stdout);
00535 
00536         } else {
00537 
00538             PredictMlat1( MirrorMLT, MirrorMlat, k, MLT, &pred_mlat, &pred_delta_mlat, &delta );
00539             if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 2) printf("\t\t%sPredicted mlat3 = %g ( %g : %g )%s ", PreStr, pred_mlat, pred_delta_mlat, delta, PostStr ); fflush(stdout);
00540 
00541         }
00542 if ( k < 3 )       delta = 3.0;
00543 else if ( k < 6 )  delta = 2.0;
00544 else if ( k < 9 )  delta = 2.0;
00545 else if ( k < 12 ) delta = 2.0;
00546 else if ( k < 15 ) delta = 2.0;
00547 else if ( k < 18 ) delta = 1.0;
00548 else if ( k < 21 ) delta = 0.5;
00549 else               delta = 0.5;
00550 delta = 5.0;
00551 //fprintf(fp_predict, "%g %g\n", MLT, pred_mlat );
00552 
00553 
00554 
00555         /*
00556          *  Now set a range to search. It should be pretty narrow to start.
00557          *  If its too small the search may fail. In which case we need to
00558          *  enlarge the search.
00559          */
00560         done2 = FALSE; FoundShellLine = FALSE; Count = 0;
00561         while ( !done2 ) {
00562 
00563             if ( Count == 0 ) {
00564 
00565                 /*
00566                  *  First time through -- lets use the predicted range.
00567                  */
00568                 //mlat0 = ((pred_mlat-delta) <  0.0) ?  0.0 : (pred_mlat-delta);
00569                 mlat0 = ((pred_mlat-delta) <  0.0) ?  0.0 : (pred_mlat-delta);
00570                 mlat1 = ((pred_mlat+delta) > 90.0) ? 90.0 : (pred_mlat+delta);
00571 
00572             } else if ( Count == 1 ) {
00573 
00574                 /*
00575                  * Perhaps our bracket was no good -- too narrow. Enlarge it.
00576                  * Try double what we had. 
00577                  */
00578                 delta *= 2;
00579                 mlat0 = ((mlat-delta) >  0.0) ?  0.0 : (mlat-delta);
00580                 mlat1 = ((mlat+delta) > 90.0) ? 90.0 : (mlat+delta);
00581 
00582             } else if ( Count == 2 ) {
00583 
00584                 /*
00585                  * Hmmm... This ones stuborn! Lets be more conservative now.
00586                 * Try +1/-5 around the returned mlat
00587                 */
00588 
00589                 if ( FoundShellLine == -3 ) {
00590                     mlat0 = ((mlat-5.0) >  0.0) ?  0.0 : (mlat-5.0);
00591                     mlat1 = ((mlat+1.0) > 90.0) ? 90.0 : (mlat+1.0);
00592                 } else {
00593                     mlat0 = ((mlat-1.0) >  0.0) ?  0.0 : (mlat-1.0);
00594                     mlat1 = ((mlat+5.0) > 90.0) ? 90.0 : (mlat+5.0);
00595                 }
00596 
00597             } else {
00598 
00599                 /*
00600                  * OK, there may not be a good line -- i.e. drift shell may not be closed.
00601                  * To make sure, lets try 0->90 deg.
00602                  */
00603                 mlat0 = 0.0;
00604 mlat0 = -30.0;
00605                 mlat1 = 90.0;
00606 
00607             }
00608 
00609 
00610             if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 1) printf("\n\t\t%s-------------------  Line %02d of %02d   MLT: %g  (mlat0, mlat1 = %g %g) ---------------------%s\n", PreStr, k, nLines, MLT, mlat0, mlat1, PostStr );
00611             FoundShellLine = FindShellLine( I, &Ifound, LstarInfo->mInfo->Bm, MLT, &mlat, &r, mlat0, mlat1, LstarInfo );
00612 
00613             if ( FoundShellLine > 0 ) {
00614                 done2 = TRUE;
00615             } else if ( Count > 2 ) {
00616                 done2 =  TRUE;
00617                 printf(" \t%sNo valid I - Drift Shell not closed: L* = undefined  (FoundShellLine = %d)%s\n", PreStr, FoundShellLine, PostStr); fflush(stdout);
00618                 FoundShellLine = 0;
00619                 return(-3);
00620             } else {
00621                 ++Count;
00622             }
00623         }
00624 
00625         /*
00626          * Save individual I values 
00627          */
00628         LstarInfo->I[k] = Ifound;
00629 
00630 
00631         MirrorMLT[k]  = MLT;
00632         MirrorMlat[k] = mlat;
00633     
00634         if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 2) printf("\t\t%sActual mlat         = %g  \t Count = %d%s", PreStr, mlat, Count, PostStr ); fflush(stdout);
00635 
00636 
00637         /*
00638          *  convert mirror point to GSM.
00639          */
00640         Phi = 15.0*(MLT-12.0)*RadPerDeg;
00641         cl = cos( mlat * RadPerDeg ); sl = sin( mlat * RadPerDeg );
00642         u.x = r*cl*cos(Phi); u.y = r*cl*sin(Phi); u.z = r*sl;
00643         Lgm_Convert_Coords( &u, &v, SM_TO_GSM, LstarInfo->mInfo->c );
00644 
00645         /*
00646          * Save GSM cartesian as well...
00647          */
00648         LstarInfo->Mirror_Pn[k] = v;
00649         LstarInfo->Mirror_Ps[k] = LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South;
00650 
00651         /*
00652          *  Trace to earth. Here we need to trace to the actual surface. This
00653          *  will give the correct L* when we are using a dipole field already.
00654          */
00655         LstarInfo->mInfo->Hmax = 0.1;
00656         //Lgm_TraceToSphericalEarth( &v, &w, 1e-6, 1.0, 1e-7, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00657         //Lgm_TraceToSphericalEarth( &v, &w, 10.0, 1.0, 1e-7, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00658         if ( !Lgm_TraceToSphericalEarth( &v, &w, 0.0, 1.0, 1e-7, LstarInfo->mInfo ) ){
00659                 return(-4);
00660         }
00661         LstarInfo->Footprint_Pn[k] = w;
00662     
00663 
00664         /*
00665          *  convert footpoint back to SM
00666          */
00667         Lgm_Convert_Coords( &w, &v, GSM_TO_SM, LstarInfo->mInfo->c );
00668         Phi = atan2( v.y, v.x );
00669         LstarInfo->MLT[k]  = Phi*DegPerRad/15.0 + 12.0;
00670         LstarInfo->mlat[k] = asin( v.z/Lgm_Magnitude(&v) )*DegPerRad;
00671         if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 2) printf(" \t%sMLT_foot, mlat_foot = %g %g%s\n\n", PreStr, LstarInfo->MLT[k], LstarInfo->mlat[k], PostStr); fflush(stdout);
00672 
00673 
00674 
00675 
00676         /*
00677          * If SaveShellLines is set true, then retrace the FL and save the
00678          * whole FL.  Note that since we appear to only have the north
00679          * footpoint. We start there and trace to south. So lets pack them in
00680          * the the saved arrays backwards so that they go from south to north.
00681          */
00682         if ( LstarInfo->SaveShellLines ) {
00683 
00684             Lgm_TraceLine( &LstarInfo->Footprint_Pn[k], &v2, 0.1, -1.0, 1e-8, FALSE, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00685             LstarInfo->Footprint_Ps[k] = v2;
00686 
00687             nnn = LstarInfo->mInfo->nPnts; smax = LstarInfo->mInfo->s[nnn-1];
00688             for (tkk=0, nfp=nnn-1; nfp>=0; nfp--){
00689                 if ( LstarInfo->mInfo->Bmag[nfp] > 0.0 ) {
00690                     LstarInfo->s_gsm[k][tkk] = smax - LstarInfo->mInfo->s[nfp];
00691                     LstarInfo->Bmag[k][tkk]  = LstarInfo->mInfo->Bmag[nfp];
00692                     LstarInfo->x_gsm[k][tkk] = LstarInfo->mInfo->Px[nfp];
00693                     LstarInfo->y_gsm[k][tkk] = LstarInfo->mInfo->Py[nfp];
00694                     LstarInfo->z_gsm[k][tkk] = LstarInfo->mInfo->Pz[nfp];
00695                     ++tkk;
00696                 }
00697             }
00698             LstarInfo->nFieldPnts[k] = tkk;
00699 
00700         }
00701 
00702 
00703 
00704 
00705 
00706 
00707 
00708 
00709 
00710 
00711         ++k;
00712 
00713     } // end MLT for loop
00714     LstarInfo->nPnts = k;
00715 
00716 
00717     /*
00718      *  Save drift shell -- it will help us predict the next one.
00719      */
00720     for (i=0; i<k; ++i){
00721         MirrorMLT_Old[i]  = MirrorMLT[i];
00722         MirrorMlat_Old[i] = MirrorMlat[i];
00723     }
00724 
00725     /*
00726      *  To get Lstar all we need to do now is one final integral.
00727      *  See roederer's eq 3.6 It should be trivial at this point!
00728      */
00729 
00730 
00731     /* 
00732      *  sort arrays so they are monotonically increasing in MLT
00733      *  (needed for spline interp).
00734      */
00735     quicksort2(  LstarInfo->nPnts, LstarInfo->MLT-1, LstarInfo->mlat-1 );
00736 
00737 
00738 
00739     /*
00740      *  Create new arrays that have the last two points repeated at the start
00741      *  and the first two points repeated at the end. We have to add/subtract 
00742      *  24 hours at the end/start. The repeated values ensure that the spline
00743 FIX
00744      *  will be periodic and continous around the globe.
00745      */ 
00746 /*
00747     j = 0;
00748     for (i=0; i<k; ++i){ LstarInfo->xa[j] = LstarInfo->MLT[i]-24.0; LstarInfo->ya[j] = LstarInfo->mlat[i]; ++j; }
00749     for (i=0; i<k; ++i){ LstarInfo->xa[j] = LstarInfo->MLT[i]     ; LstarInfo->ya[j] = LstarInfo->mlat[i]; ++j; }
00750     for (i=0; i<k; ++i){ LstarInfo->xa[j] = LstarInfo->MLT[i]+24.0; LstarInfo->ya[j] = LstarInfo->mlat[i]; ++j; }
00751     spline( LstarInfo->xa, LstarInfo->ya, LstarInfo->nSplnPnts, 0.0, 0.0, LstarInfo->y2 );
00752 */
00753 
00754     j = 0;
00755     for (i=0; i<k; ++i){ LstarInfo->xa[j] = LstarInfo->MLT[i]-24.0; LstarInfo->ya[j] = LstarInfo->mlat[i]; ++j; }
00756     for (i=0; i<k; ++i){ LstarInfo->xa[j] = LstarInfo->MLT[i]     ; LstarInfo->ya[j] = LstarInfo->mlat[i]; ++j; }
00757     for (i=0; i<k; ++i){ LstarInfo->xa[j] = LstarInfo->MLT[i]+24.0; LstarInfo->ya[j] = LstarInfo->mlat[i]; ++j; }
00758     LstarInfo->nSplnPnts = j;
00759 
00760     /*
00761      *  Use GSL periodic spline (can also try others if needed....)
00762      */
00763 //    gsl_set_error_handler_off(); // Turn off gsl default error handler
00764     LstarInfo->acc = gsl_interp_accel_alloc( );
00765     LstarInfo->pspline = gsl_interp_alloc( gsl_interp_cspline_periodic, LstarInfo->nSplnPnts );
00766     //printf ("spline uses '%s' interpolation.\n", gsl_interp_name( LstarInfo->pspline ));
00767     gsl_interp_init( LstarInfo->pspline, LstarInfo->xa, LstarInfo->ya, LstarInfo->nSplnPnts );
00768 
00769 
00770 
00771 
00772 
00773 
00774 
00775 
00776 /*
00777 For debugging...
00778     fp = fopen("ShellFootTrace.dat", "w");
00779     for (MLT=-24.0; MLT<=48.0; MLT += 0.01){
00780         //splint( LstarInfo->xa, LstarInfo->ya, LstarInfo->y2, LstarInfo->nSplnPnts, MLT, &mlat);
00781         mlat = gsl_interp_eval( LstarInfo->pspline, LstarInfo->xa, LstarInfo->ya, MLT, LstarInfo->acc );
00782         fprintf(fp, "%g %g\n", MLT, mlat);
00783     }
00784     fclose(fp);
00785 */
00786 
00787 
00788     Phi1 = MagFlux( LstarInfo );
00789     LstarInfo->LS_dip_approx = -2.0*M_PI*LstarInfo->mInfo->c->M_cd /Phi1;
00790     Phi2 = MagFlux2( LstarInfo );
00791     LstarInfo->LS = -2.0*M_PI*LstarInfo->mInfo->c->M_cd /Phi2;
00792     LstarInfo->LS_McIlwain_M = -2.0*M_PI*LstarInfo->mInfo->c->M_cd_McIllwain /Phi2;
00793 
00794     if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 0) {
00795         printf("\n\t\t%sL*, Dipole Approximation.\n%s", PreStr, PostStr );
00796         printf("\t\t%s  Magnetic Flux:                         %.15lf%s\n", PreStr, Phi1, PostStr );
00797         printf("\t\t%s  L*:                                    %.15lf%s\n", PreStr, LstarInfo->LS_dip_approx, PostStr );
00798         printf("\t\t%s  L* (Using McIllwain M):                %.15lf%s\n", PreStr, -2.0*M_PI*LstarInfo->mInfo->c->M_cd_McIllwain /Phi1, PostStr );
00799         printf("\n\t\t%sL*, Full Field.%s\n", PreStr, PostStr );
00800         printf("\t\t%s  Magnetic Flux:                         %.15lf%s\n", PreStr, Phi2, PostStr );
00801         printf("\t\t%s  L*:                                    %.15lf%s\n", PreStr, LstarInfo->LS, PostStr );
00802         printf("\t\t%s  L* (Using McIllwain M):                %.15lf%s\n\n\n\n", PreStr, -2.0*M_PI*LstarInfo->mInfo->c->M_cd_McIllwain /Phi2, PostStr );
00803     }
00804 
00805     gsl_interp_free( LstarInfo->pspline );
00806     gsl_interp_accel_free( LstarInfo->acc );
00807     
00808 
00809     return(0);
00810 
00811 }
00812 
00813 
00814 
00815 double MagFluxIntegrand( double Phi, _qpInfo *qpInfo ) {
00816                                                                                                                                                   
00817                                                                                                                                                   
00818     double  MLT, mlat, c;
00819     Lgm_LstarInfo  *LstarInfo;
00820                                                                                                                                                   
00821 
00822     MLT = Phi*DegPerRad/15.0;
00823                                                                                                                                                   
00824                                                                                                                                                   
00825     /*
00826      *  Get pointer to our auxilliary data structure.
00827      */
00828     LstarInfo = (Lgm_LstarInfo *)qpInfo;
00829                                                                                                                                                   
00830 //    gsl_set_error_handler_off(); // Turn off gsl default error handler
00831     mlat = gsl_interp_eval( LstarInfo->pspline, LstarInfo->xa, LstarInfo->ya, MLT, LstarInfo->acc );
00832     //splint( LstarInfo->xa, LstarInfo->ya, LstarInfo->y2, LstarInfo->nSplnPnts, MLT, &mlat);
00833 
00834     c = cos( mlat*RadPerDeg );
00835 
00836     return( c*c );
00837 
00838 }
00839 
00840 
00841 
00842 double MagFlux( Lgm_LstarInfo *LstarInfo ) {
00843 
00844     double      a, b;
00845     double      epsabs, epsrel, result, abserr;
00846     int         key, neval, ier, limit, lenw, last, iwork[501];
00847     double      work[2001];
00848     _qpInfo     *qpInfo;
00849                                                                                                                                                   
00850                                                                                                                                                   
00851     /*
00852      *  Type-cast our data structure to a generic type.
00853      *  The structure holds auzilliary info we need down
00854      *  in the function calls.
00855      */
00856     qpInfo = (_qpInfo *)LstarInfo;
00857                                                                                                                                                   
00858                                                                                                                                                   
00859                                                                                                                                                   
00860     /*
00861      *  Limits of integration.
00862      */
00863     a = 0.0;
00864     b = 2.0*M_PI;
00865                                                                                                                                                   
00866                                                                                                                                                   
00867                                                                                                                                                   
00868     /*
00869      *   set tolerances.
00870      */
00871     //epsabs = 0.0;
00872     //epsrel = 1e-5;
00873     epsabs = LstarInfo->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsabs;
00874     epsabs = LstarInfo->mInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsrel;
00875 
00876 
00877                                                                                                                                                   
00878     limit = 500; lenw = 4*limit; key = 6;
00879 /*
00880     iwork  = (int *) calloc( limit+1, sizeof(int) );
00881     work   = (double *) calloc( lenw+1, sizeof(double) );
00882 */
00883     dqags(MagFluxIntegrand, qpInfo, a, b, epsabs, epsrel, &result, &abserr, &neval, &ier, limit, lenw, &last, iwork, work);
00884 /*
00885     free( iwork );
00886     free( work );
00887 */
00888                                                                                                                                                   
00889                                                                                                                                                   
00890                                                                                                                                                   
00891     return( -result*LstarInfo->mInfo->c->M_cd );
00892                                                                                                                                                   
00893 }
00894 
00895 
00896 
00897 
00898 
00899 
00900 
00901 
00902 
00903 
00904 
00905 
00906 /*
00907  *  Lets integrate the real field. I.e. dont assume a dipole field
00908  */
00909 double LambdaIntegrand( double Lambda, _qpInfo *qpInfo ) {
00910                                                                                                                                                   
00911                                                                                                                                                   
00912     double  cl, sl, st, ct, sp, cp, Br, Bx, By, Bz, f;
00913     double  MLT, phi;
00914     Lgm_Vector  u, w, Bvec;
00915     Lgm_LstarInfo  *LstarInfo;
00916                                                                                                                                                   
00917     /*
00918      *  Get pointer to our auxilliary data structure.
00919      */
00920     LstarInfo = (Lgm_LstarInfo *)qpInfo;
00921 
00922     MLT = LstarInfo->Phi*DegPerRad/15.0;
00923 phi = 15.0*(MLT-12.0)*RadPerDeg;
00924     cl = cos( Lambda ); sl = sin( Lambda );
00925     u.x = cl*cos( phi );
00926     u.y = cl*sin( phi );
00927     u.z = sl;
00928     Lgm_Convert_Coords( &u, &w, SM_TO_GSM, LstarInfo->mInfo->c );
00929 
00930     
00931     LstarInfo->mInfo->Bfield( &w, &Bvec, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00932     Lgm_Convert_Coords( &Bvec, &u, GSM_TO_SM, LstarInfo->mInfo->c );
00933     Bx = u.x; By = u.y; Bz = u.z;
00934 
00935     st = sin( M_PI/2.0 - Lambda ); ct = cos( M_PI/2.0 - Lambda ); sp = sin( phi ); cp = cos( phi );
00936     Br = st*cp*Bx + st*sp*By + ct*Bz;
00937 
00938     f = Br*cos( Lambda );
00939 
00940     return( f );
00941 
00942 }
00943 
00944 
00945 double LambdaIntegral( Lgm_LstarInfo *LstarInfo ) {
00946 
00947     double      a, b;
00948     double      epsabs, epsrel, result, abserr;
00949     int         key, neval, ier, limit, lenw, last, iwork[501];
00950     double      work[2001], MLT, mlat;
00951     _qpInfo     *qpInfo;
00952                                                                                                                                                   
00953                                                                                                                                                   
00954     /*
00955      *  Type-cast our data structure to a generic type.
00956      *  The structure holds auzilliary info we need down
00957      *  in the function calls.
00958      */
00959     qpInfo = (_qpInfo *)LstarInfo;
00960                                                                                                                                                   
00961     /*
00962      *  Get Latitude 
00963      */
00964     MLT = LstarInfo->Phi*DegPerRad/15.0;
00965 //    gsl_set_error_handler_off(); // Turn off gsl default error handler
00966     mlat = gsl_interp_eval( LstarInfo->pspline, LstarInfo->xa, LstarInfo->ya, MLT, LstarInfo->acc );
00967     //splint( LstarInfo->xa, LstarInfo->ya, LstarInfo->y2, LstarInfo->nSplnPnts, MLT, &mlat);
00968     mlat *= RadPerDeg;
00969                                                                                                                                                   
00970                                                                                                                                                   
00971     /*
00972      *  Limits of integration for lambda integral.
00973      */
00974     a = mlat;
00975     b = M_PI/2.0;
00976 
00977                                                                                                                                                   
00978                                                                                                                                                   
00979                                                                                                                                                   
00980     /*
00981      *   set tolerances.
00982      */
00983     //epsabs = 0.0;
00984     //epsrel = 1e-3;
00985     epsabs = LstarInfo->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsabs;
00986     epsrel = LstarInfo->mInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsrel;
00987                                                                                                                                                   
00988     limit = 500; lenw = 4*limit; key = 6;
00989 /*
00990     iwork  = (int *) calloc( limit+1, sizeof(int) );
00991     work   = (double *) calloc( lenw+1, sizeof(double) );
00992 */
00993     dqags(LambdaIntegrand, qpInfo, a, b, epsabs, epsrel, &result, &abserr, &neval, &ier, limit, lenw, &last, iwork, work);
00994 /*
00995     free( iwork );
00996     free( work );
00997 */
00998                                                                                                                                                   
00999                                                                                                                                                   
01000                                                                                                                                                   
01001     return( result );
01002                                                                                                                                                   
01003 }
01004 
01005 double MagFluxIntegrand2( double Phi, _qpInfo *qpInfo ) {
01006                                                                                                                                                   
01007                                                                                                                                                   
01008     double  f;
01009     Lgm_LstarInfo  *LstarInfo;
01010                                                                                                                                                   
01011     /*
01012      *  Get pointer to our auxilliary data structure.
01013      */
01014     LstarInfo = (Lgm_LstarInfo *)qpInfo;
01015 
01016     LstarInfo->Phi = Phi;
01017     f = LambdaIntegral( LstarInfo );
01018 
01019     return( f );
01020 
01021 }
01022 
01023 double MagFlux2( Lgm_LstarInfo *LstarInfo ) {
01024 
01025     double      a, b;
01026     double      epsabs, epsrel, result, abserr;
01027     int         key, neval, ier, limit, lenw, last, iwork[501];
01028     double      work[2001];
01029     _qpInfo     *qpInfo;
01030                                                                                                                                                   
01031                                                                                                                                                   
01032     /*
01033      *  Type-cast our data structure to a generic type.
01034      *  The structure holds auzilliary info we need down
01035      *  in the function calls.
01036      */
01037     qpInfo = (_qpInfo *)LstarInfo;
01038                                                                                                                                                   
01039                                                                                                                                                   
01040                                                                                                                                                   
01041     /*
01042      *  Limits of integration.
01043      */
01044     a = 0.0;
01045     b = 2.0*M_PI;
01046                                                                                                                                                   
01047                                                                                                                                                   
01048                                                                                                                                                   
01049     /*
01050      *   set tolerances.
01051      */
01052     epsabs = 0.0;
01053     epsrel = 1e-5;
01054                                                                                                                                                   
01055     limit = 500; lenw = 4*limit; key = 6;
01056 /*
01057     iwork  = (int *) calloc( limit+1, sizeof(int) );
01058     work   = (double *) calloc( lenw+1, sizeof(double) );
01059 */
01060     dqags(MagFluxIntegrand2, qpInfo, a, b, epsabs, epsrel, &result, &abserr, &neval, &ier, limit, lenw, &last, iwork, work);
01061 /*
01062     free( iwork );
01063     free( work );
01064 */
01065                                                                                                                                                   
01066                                                                                                                                                   
01067                                                                                                                                                   
01068     return( result );
01069                                                                                                                                                   
01070 }
01071 
01072 void PredictMlat1( double *MirrorMLT, double *MirrorMlat, int k, double MLT, double *pred_mlat, double *pred_delta_mlat, double *delta ) {
01073 
01074     int     nk, koffset;
01075     double  pred_mlat1, pred_mlat2, pred_delta_mlat1, pred_delta_mlat2;
01076 
01077 
01078     if ( k == 0 ){
01079 
01080         /*
01081          *  Really shouldnt be here. We should realy lonly be called
01082          *  with some data to predict with
01083          */
01084         *pred_mlat       = 45.0;
01085         *pred_delta_mlat = 45.0;
01086         *delta       = 45.0;
01087 
01088     } else if ( k == 1 ) {
01089 
01090         *pred_mlat   = MirrorMlat[0];
01091         *pred_delta_mlat = 5.0;
01092         *delta       = 5.0;
01093 
01094     } else if ( k == 2 ) {
01095 
01096         *pred_mlat   = 0.5*(MirrorMlat[0]+MirrorMlat[1]);
01097         *pred_delta_mlat = 2.5;
01098         *delta       = 2.5;
01099 
01100     } else {
01101 
01102         if ( k > 4 ) {
01103             koffset = k-5;
01104             nk = 5;
01105         } else {
01106             koffset = 0;
01107             nk = k;
01108         }
01109 
01110                                                                                                                                                                                                   
01111         Lgm_RatFunInt( MirrorMLT+koffset-1, MirrorMlat+koffset-1, nk, MLT, &pred_mlat1, &pred_delta_mlat1 );
01112         Lgm_PolFunInt( MirrorMLT+koffset-1, MirrorMlat+koffset-1, nk, MLT, &pred_mlat2, &pred_delta_mlat2 );
01113  
01114         /*
01115          *  Make certain we have sane predictions
01116          */
01117         if ( !isnan(pred_mlat1) && !isnan(pred_mlat2) ) {
01118             *pred_mlat = 0.5*(pred_mlat1 + pred_mlat2);
01119             *pred_delta_mlat = fabs(pred_delta_mlat1) + fabs(pred_delta_mlat2);
01120         } else if ( !isnan(pred_mlat1) ) {
01121             *pred_mlat = pred_mlat1;
01122             *pred_delta_mlat = fabs(pred_delta_mlat1);
01123         } else if ( !isnan(pred_mlat2) ) {
01124             *pred_mlat = pred_mlat2;
01125             *pred_delta_mlat = fabs(pred_delta_mlat2);
01126         } else {
01127             *pred_mlat = MirrorMlat[0];
01128             *pred_delta_mlat = 2.0;
01129         }
01130                                                                                                                                                                                                       
01131         if ( ( *pred_mlat < 0.0) || ( *pred_mlat > 90.0 ) ){
01132             *pred_mlat = MirrorMlat[0];
01133             *pred_delta_mlat = 2.0;
01134             }
01135                                                                                                                                                                                                       
01136         }
01137 
01138 
01139         if ( (*pred_delta_mlat < 1e-12) || isnan(*pred_delta_mlat) ) {
01140             *delta = 2.0;
01141         } else {
01142             *delta = 1.5*(*pred_delta_mlat);
01143         }
01144 
01145         if ( *delta < .2 ) *delta = 0.2;
01146                                                                                                                                                                                                   
01147 
01148 }
01149 
01150 
01151 void PredictMlat2( double *MirrorMLT, double *MirrorMlat, int k, double MLT, double *pred_mlat, double *pred_delta_mlat, double *delta, Lgm_LstarInfo *LstarInfo ) {
01152 
01153     double  mlat;
01154     int     j, i;
01155 
01156 
01157 
01158     if ( k == 0 ){
01159 
01160         /*
01161          *  Really shouldnt be here. We should realy lonly be called
01162          *  with some data to predict with
01163          */
01164         *pred_mlat       = 45.0;
01165         *pred_delta_mlat = 45.0;
01166         *delta       = 45.0;
01167 
01168     } else if ( k == 1 ) {
01169 
01170         *pred_mlat   = MirrorMlat[0];
01171         *pred_delta_mlat = 5.0;
01172         *delta       = 5.0;
01173 
01174     } else if ( k == 2 ) {
01175 
01176         *pred_mlat   = 0.5*(MirrorMlat[0]+MirrorMlat[1]);
01177         *pred_delta_mlat = 2.5;
01178         *delta       = 2.5;
01179 
01180     } else {
01181 
01182         /*
01183          *  Create new arrays that have the last two points repeated at the start
01184          *  and the first two points repeated at the end. We have to add/subtract
01185          *  24 hours at the end/start. The repeated values ensure that the spline
01186          *  will be periodic and continous around the globe.
01187          */
01188 
01189         /*
01190          *  sort arrays so they are monotonically increasing in MLT
01191          *  (needed for spline interp).
01192          */
01193         quicksort2(  k, MirrorMLT-1, MirrorMlat-1 );
01194 
01195 /*
01196         j = 0;
01197         LstarInfo->xma[j] = MirrorMLT[k-2]-24.0; LstarInfo->yma[j] = MirrorMlat[k-2]; ++j;
01198         LstarInfo->xma[j] = MirrorMLT[k-1]-24.0; LstarInfo->yma[j] = MirrorMlat[k-1]; ++j;
01199         for (i=0; i<k; ++i){ LstarInfo->xma[j] = MirrorMLT[i]; LstarInfo->yma[j] = MirrorMlat[i]; ++j; }
01200         LstarInfo->xma[j] = MirrorMLT[0]+24.0; LstarInfo->yma[j] = MirrorMlat[0]; ++j;
01201         LstarInfo->xma[j] = MirrorMLT[1]+24.0; LstarInfo->yma[j] = MirrorMlat[1]; ++j;
01202         LstarInfo->m = j;
01203 */
01204 
01205         j = 0;
01206         for (i=0; i<k; ++i){ LstarInfo->xma[j] = MirrorMLT[i]-24.0; LstarInfo->yma[j] = MirrorMlat[i]; ++j; }
01207         for (i=0; i<k; ++i){ LstarInfo->xma[j] = MirrorMLT[i]     ; LstarInfo->yma[j] = MirrorMlat[i]; ++j; }
01208         for (i=0; i<k; ++i){ LstarInfo->xma[j] = MirrorMLT[i]+24.0; LstarInfo->yma[j] = MirrorMlat[i]; ++j; }
01209         LstarInfo->m = j;
01210 
01211 
01212         gsl_set_error_handler_off(); // Turn off gsl default error handler
01213         gsl_interp_accel *acc = gsl_interp_accel_alloc( );
01214         gsl_interp *pspline = gsl_interp_alloc( gsl_interp_akima_periodic, LstarInfo->m );
01215         gsl_interp_init( pspline, LstarInfo->xma, LstarInfo->yma, LstarInfo->m );
01216         mlat = gsl_interp_eval( pspline, LstarInfo->xma, LstarInfo->yma, MLT, acc );
01217         gsl_interp_free( pspline );
01218         gsl_interp_accel_free( acc );
01219 
01220         /* old num rec. stuff
01221         spline( LstarInfo->xma, LstarInfo->yma, LstarInfo->m, 0.0, 0.0, LstarInfo->ym2 );
01222         splint( LstarInfo->xma, LstarInfo->yma, LstarInfo->ym2, LstarInfo->m, MLT, &mlat);
01223         */
01224 
01225 
01226         *pred_mlat       = mlat;
01227         *pred_delta_mlat = 0.75;
01228         *delta           = 0.75;
01229 
01230     }
01231 
01232 
01233 
01234 }
01235 
01236 
01237 
01238 
01239
